1.3.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /concerts by url
1.3.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
1.3.helptext: Make sure you can reach the concerts page directly from the /concerts URL.

1.4.1.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /concerts by Navbar
1.4.1.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
1.4.1.helptext: Make sure you can reach the concerts page from the navbar.

1.4.2.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /concerts by clicking button
1.4.2.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
1.4.2.helptext: Make sure you can access the concerts page by clicking the button.

1.6.1.title: Checkout Basic Setup Adds 2 tickets (3 total)
1.6.1.learner_prompt: When the buyer selects a number of tickets from the Concerts page, their Checkout Session should reflect the same number of tickets.
1.6.1.helptext: Double-check that the values getting set in the Concerts UI are being passed to the Checkout Session.

1.6.2.title: Renders Stripe Checkout successfully - Total and Currency Check
1.6.2.learner_prompt: Use the config file to set ticket pricing.
1.6.2.helptext: Make sure you are pulling your currency and amount from the config file.

1.6.3.title: Renders Stripe Checkout Product successfully - Product Name and Image check
1.6.3.learner_prompt: Use the config file to set the concert's name and product image.
1.6.3.helptext: Make sure you are pulling your product name and image link from the config file.

1.7.title: Renders Stripe Checkout successfully - Card Payment Method Check
1.7.learner_prompt: For this challenge, the merchant only wants to accept credit cards.

1.8.title: Renders Stripe Checkout successfully - Cancel and Success Url Check
1.8.helptext: Check if successful checkouts are being redirected to a new page.

1.9.title: Renders Stripe Checkout successfully - Payment Intent Metadata Check
1.9.learner_prompt: A webhook of a successful checkout should be caught to update the metadata with the number of concert tickets purchased.
1.9.helptext: Check if metadata is being set for the checkout and a webhook endpoint exists.

1.10.title: Renders Stripe Checkout successfully - Cancel and Success Url Check
1.10.learner_prompt: Canceling the checkout should return to /concerts.
1.10.helptext: Check if the back button is working in the Stripe checkout page.

2.3.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /videos by url
2.3.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
2.3.helptext: Make sure you can reach the concerts page directly from the /videos URL.

2.4.1.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /videos by Navbar
2.4.1.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
2.4.1.helptext: Make sure you can reach the videos page from the navbar.

2.4.2.title: Checkout Basic Setup visits page /videos by clicking button
2.4.2.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
2.4.2.helptext: Make sure you can access the videos page by clicking the button.

2.6.title: Check Stripe Js is loaded
2.6.helptext: Make sure Stripe.js is configured correctly.

2.7.title: Check Stripe Elements are loaded
2.7.helptext: Make sure Elements is implemented correctly.

2.8.title: Add Single Item to Cart Enables Payment form
2.8.learner_prompt: When a customer selects an item, open the payment form.
2.8.helptext: Make sure the pay button is shown when the cart is populated.

2.9.title: Add Multiple Items to Cart Enables Payment form
2.9.learner_prompt: When a customer chooses multiple items, the payment form reflects these changes.
2.9.helptext: Make sure multiple items can be added to the checkout form.

2.10.title: Add / Remove Multiple Items to Cart Check Payment form
2.10.learner_prompt: When a customer removes items, the payment form reflects these changes.
2.10.helptext: Make sure items can be added and removed from the checkout form.

2.11.title: Check Payment Form Fields
2.11.learner_prompt: The customer can add payment details.
2.11.helptext: Make sure payment info can be added to the form.

2.12.title: Check Name and Email fields are required for Payment
2.12.learner_prompt: The customer is required to add a name and email to their order.
2.12.helptext: Make sure name and email are required fields.

2.13.title: Check Payment button is disabled during the Payment call
2.13.learner_prompt: The customer can't submit the form while it's processing.
2.13.helptext: Make sure the pay button cannot be pressed during a call to the server.

2.14.learner_prompt: The customer can't submit the form while it's processing.
2.14.helptext: Make sure a spinner is displayed to the customer after submitting payment details.

2.15.title: Check Normal Payment is Successful
2.15.learner_prompt: A normal test card can be used to check out.
2.15.helptext: Make sure a non-3DS card can be used to pay with.

2.16.title: Check 3DS Payment is Successful
2.16.learner_prompt: A 3DS test card can be used to check out.
2.16.helptext: Make sure a 3DS card can be used to pay with.

2.17.title: Check Unsuccessful Payment
2.17.learner_prompt: If the card is declined, show the customer the error.
2.17.helptext: Make sure the payment failure error is shown to the customer.

2.18.title: Check 3DS Payment is Unsuccessful
2.18.learner_prompt: If the 3DS card is declined, show the customer the error.
2.18.helptext: Make sure the 3DS payment failure error is shown to the customer.

2.19.title: Should allow Customer to update Order after Decline
2.19.learner_prompt: If the customer's payment method fails, they are still able to edit their order.
2.19.helptext: Make sure a customer can update their order after a card decline.

2.20.title: Should use Original Payment Intent upon Order Failure and subsequent Cart Update
2.20.learner_prompt: One payment intent is used per customer, regardless of a failed payment event.
2.20.helptext: Make sure the failed payment intent is used for the subsequent successful payment for the same customer.

2.27.title: Should make the Payments in USD
2.27.learner_prompt: Payments should be made in USD.
2.27.helptext: Check the payment intent's currency field.

2.28.title: Should include Video IDs in the metadata
2.28.learner_prompt: Video IDs should be added to the payment intent's metadata.
2.28.helptext: Check the metadata of the payment intent.

2.29.title: Should include Video IDs in the Statement Descriptor
2.29.learner_prompt: Video IDs should be added to the payment intent's statement descriptor.
2.29.helptext: Check the statement descriptor of the payment intent.

2.30.title: Should set the payment_intent.receipt_email with the Correct Email ID
2.30.learner_prompt: A payment receipt is sent to the test customer's email.

3.3.title: Should Load Lesson Courses Page from Main Page
3.3.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
3.3.helptext: Make sure you can reach the lessons page.

3.4.title: Should Load Lesson Courses Page via URL
3.4.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
3.4.helptext: Make sure you can reach the lessons page directly from the /lessons URL.

3.7.title: Should load Sripe Elements
3.7.helptext: Make sure Elements is implemented correctly.

3.8.helptext: Make sure the payment form is shown after selecting a lesson time.

3.9.title: Should allow user to change Lesson Time after Elements is shown
3.9.learner_prompt: A customer can change lesson times after the payment form is shown.
3.9.helptext: Check if the customer can change lessons times after the payment form is shown.

3.10.title: Should collect necessary Inputs from User
3.10.learner_prompt: The payment form should take the customer's payment details.
3.10.helptext: Check if field inputs are being collected.

3.11.title: Should have Email and Name as Mandatory Fields
3.11.learner_prompt: The customer needs to supply their name and email to the form.
3.11.helptext: Check if name and email are required fields.

3.12.title: Should disable the Request Lesson Button while Payment Intents are created/used
3.12.learner_prompt: The 'Request Lesson' button cannot be clicked while processing.
3.12.helptext: Check if the 'Request Lesson' button is disabled while a payment is processing.

3.13.title: Should disable the Request Lesson Button and show Spinner while Confirming Card Payment
3.13.learner_prompt: The button should display a Spinner while processing.
3.13.helptext: Check if a Spinner is shown on the button during payment processing.

3.21.title: Should schedule a Lesson using a non 3DS Card
3.21.learner_prompt: A normal test card can be used to check out.

3.22.title: Should schedule a Lesson using a 3DS Card
3.22.learner_prompt: A 3DS test card can be used to check out.

3.23.title: Should show Last 4 Card Digits after Successful Payment
3.23.learner_prompt: After confirmation, a Success message should be shown the customer with their last 4 digits of the card they used.
3.23.helptext: Make sure the last 4 digits of the card is shown in the Success message after the lesson is confirmed.

3.24.title: Should not allow Customer to use same Email Twice for Lesson Registration
3.24.learner_prompt: The same customer can't schedule multiple lessons.
3.24.helptext: Make sure a customer with the same email can't schedule multiple lessons.

3.25.title: Should Display Card Declined Error Message when Invalid Card is used
3.25.learner_prompt: If the card is declined, show the customer the error.

3.26.title: Should Display Card Declined Error Message when Invalid 3DS Card is used
3.26.learner_prompt: If the 3DS card is declined, show the customer the error.

3.27.title: Should allow Customer to Successfully Update and Make a Payment after Card Decline
3.27.learner_prompt: A customer can pay with another card if a previous one is declined.
3.27.helptext: Make sure customers can use another card if a previous one is declined.

4.1.1.title: Should Accept Customer, Amount, and Description as its Input Parameters

4.1.3.title: Should Return a Payment Intent Object upon Succesful Scheduling of a Lesson

4.1.4.title: Should Return an Error when using an Invalid Customer ID

4.1.5.title: Should Create Payment Intents in USD

4.2.1.title: Should Accept Payment Intent ID and an Optional Amount as Input Parameters

4.2.2.title: Should Capture and Confirm the Payment Intent

4.2.3.title: Should Return a Payment Intent Object upon Succesful Payment Capture

4.3.1.title: Should Accept Payment Intent ID and an Amount as Input Parameters

4.3.2.title: Should Refund the Customer for the Lesson Amount

4.3.3.title: Should Return a Refund Object ID if the Refund was Successful

4.3.4.title: Should Return an Error when using Invalid Paramaters

5.1.1.title: Should load the Account Update Page and Display the details
5.1.1.learner_prompt: Maintain all of the site's existing pages and navigation.
5.1.1.helptext: Make sure you can reach the Account Update Page page.

5.1.3.title: Should allow Customer to Update Card Data without filling Name and EmailId
5.1.3.learner_prompt: The customer can update their payment method and the updated details will be displayed.
5.1.3.helptext: Make sure the customer can update their payment details.

5.1.4.title: Should not allow usage of existing Customer Email ID while Updating Account Info
5.1.4.learner_prompt: The customer can't change their email to one that's already taken.
5.1.4.helptext: Make sure an error is shown if the customer tries to change their email to one that's already taken.

5.1.6.title: Should show Error Message if Invalid Card is used while Updating Account Info
5.1.6.learner_prompt: If the card is declined, show the customer the error.

5.1.7.title: Should show Error Message if Invalid 3DS Card is used while Updating Account Info
5.1.7.learner_prompt: If the 3DS card is declined, show the customer the error.

5.1.8.title: Should allow Customer to Successfully Update Payment after Card Decline
5.1.8.learner_prompt: If the customer's card is declined, they may update it.
5.1.8.helptext: Make sure a declined card won't save to the customer's account.
